security: Transmitting information regarding the use of a diplomatic pouch to send letters into Cuba could potentially compromise diplomatic channels or reveal sensitive methods of communication.
summary: A dispatch from the Chief of Base, JHWAVE, to Chief, WRD, transmitting photostatic copies of letters sent to Lucas Moran, a representative of the Movimiento Democrata Cristiano in Cuba.
summary_one_paragraph: On June 22, 1961, the Chief of Base at JHWAVE sent a dispatch, UFGA-1739, to Chief, WRD, concerning the transmittal of photostatic copies of two letters to Lucas Moran, a representative of the Movimiento Democrata Cristiano in Cuba. The letters, originally written by Jose Ignacio RASCO and Rafael AGUIRRE, discuss RASCO's connection with the HDC and were obtained by AMULLA-1, who arranged for their duplication before attempting to send the originals to Cuba via the diplomatic pouch of the Italian Embassy.
title: Transmittal of Letters Sent to Movimiento Democrata Cristiano Representative in Cuba
